comments:
I have a project setup using cygwin.  In the C/C++ projects view for my project 
I have the "includes" directory.  I expanded it and selected a type in the 
file, right-clicked and chose rename.  (not the brightest thing to do I know 
but...)

I get a ClassCastException in 
Checks.checkIfTuBroken(ICElement) on the following line:
ITranslationUnit tu= (ITranslationUnit)CoreModel.getDefault().create
(element.getUnderlyingResource());

The problem is CoreMode returns a CProject back not an ITranslationUnit because 
the resource is outside of the workspace.

I get an NPE now when I try this. John can you see what is causing it.

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.InternalASTServiceProvider.getTranslationUnit(InternalASTServiceProvider.java:86)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.core.dom.CDOM.getTranslationUnit(CDOM.java:139)

org.eclipse.cdt.internal.refactoring.CRenameProcessor.checkInitialConditions(CRenameProcessor.java:87)

	at
org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.CheckConditionsOperation.run(CheckConditionsOperation.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1719)

I've checked in something that circumvents the NPE.  
Now an error dialog comes up that says "No source". 
Markus, if this is OK by you mark it as resolved in RC3.

Refactoring shall never change code outside of the workspace,
so that's ok for me.
